title: Canna Club Student Organization
subtitle: Vice President - Cannabis advocacy, education, and social equity
shortDescription: Vice President of student-run organization focused on cannabis advocacy, education, and social equity. Led initiatives including educational discussions, harm reduction volunteering, and community outreach.
longDescription: As Vice President of Canna Club, I helped lead a student-run organization dedicated to bringing together individuals who share a passion for cannabis advocacy, education, and social equity. Our mission is to create an informed, inclusive, and judgment-free campus community where students can learn about cannabis safely and responsibly.
highlights: Served as Vice President of award-winning student organization
Organized Canna Talk educational discussion series on campus
Led letter-writing campaigns to support incarcerated cannabis prisoners
Coordinated harm reduction volunteering and community drives
Advocated for social equity initiatives in cannabis policy
Received Outstanding Student Organization Award (2025)
challenges: Addressing stigma and misinformation around cannabis while fostering open, evidence-based dialogue on campus. We overcame this by partnering with industry professionals and hosting peer-led educational sessions that encouraged informed decision-making.
outcome: Successfully built an inclusive campus community around cannabis education. Received Outstanding Student Organization Award in 2025. Established lasting partnerships with industry professionals and community organizations, creating a model for responsible cannabis advocacy on campus.

title: Competitive Market Research - CRATIV
subtitle: Cannabis packaging industry analysis across US and Canada
shortDescription: Conducted comprehensive competitive market research for CRATIV Packaging Solutions, analyzing cannabis packaging companies across the United States and Canada to inform strategic decision-making.
longDescription: During my internship at CRATIV Packaging Solutions, I conducted competitive analysis and market research focused on the cannabis packaging industry. This project involved researching companies across the United States and Canada, analyzing their product offerings, pricing strategies, brand positioning, and overall market activity.
highlights: Researched cannabis packaging companies across US and Canada
Analyzed product offerings, pricing strategies, and brand positioning
Compiled structured reports to support strategic decision-making
Identified market trends in sustainable packaging solutions
Presented competitive intelligence findings to leadership team
Strengthened skills in market research and data analysis
challenges: Gathering comprehensive competitive intelligence in a rapidly evolving regulated industry with varying state and provincial laws. Developed systematic research methodology to ensure accurate and actionable data collection.
outcome: Delivered detailed competitive analysis that informed CRATIV's strategic planning and market positioning. Reports were used by leadership to identify growth opportunities and refine product development strategies in the cannabis packaging space.

title: Babe's Refreshments Business Plan
subtitle: Sustainable beverage business for Front Range farmers markets
shortDescription: Developed comprehensive business plan for Babe's Refreshments, a sustainable farmers market beverage stand offering fresh-squeezed juices with environmentally conscious practices and reusable glassware program.
longDescription: Created a complete business plan for Babe's Refreshments, a local beverage concept designed for farmers markets in the Front Range region. The business offers fresh-squeezed lemonade, limeade, orange juice, and apple juice made with high-quality ingredients, while emphasizing sustainability and community values.
highlights: Developed comprehensive business plan including market analysis and financial projections
Designed sustainable business model with reusable glassware (mason jars) and stainless steel straws
Created 5% discount incentive program for customers who return and reuse containers
Focused on high-quality, fresh-squeezed beverages for health-conscious consumers
Aligned brand with environmental consciousness and waste reduction
Targeted Front Range farmers markets for local community engagement
challenges: Balancing sustainability goals with operational efficiency and profit margins. Designed innovative return program that encourages eco-friendly behavior while building customer loyalty and reducing costs over time.
outcome: Completed detailed business plan demonstrating viability of sustainable beverage business. The reusable container program differentiates the brand while reducing environmental impact and building community relationships through shared values.

title: Customer Service Excellence at Chipotle
subtitle: Fast-paced food service and team collaboration
shortDescription: Delivered exceptional customer service in high-volume environment, collaborating with team members to optimize workflow and maintain food safety standards.
longDescription: As a crew member at Chipotle, I developed strong customer service skills while working in a fast-paced restaurant environment. I prepared custom food orders, managed cash register operations, and collaborated with 5-10 team members per shift to ensure smooth operations and customer satisfaction.
highlights: Served 100+ customers daily with personalized service
Maintained 100% food safety compliance through proper handling procedures
Collaborated with diverse team to optimize workflow during peak hours
Acquired cashier experience managing transactions and handling customer inquiries
Adapted quickly to fast-paced environment and high-pressure situations
challenges: Managing high customer volume during lunch and dinner rushes while maintaining quality and speed. Developed efficient multi-tasking strategies and clear communication with team members to keep operations flowing smoothly.
outcome: Consistently received positive customer feedback and contributed to team efficiency. Developed valuable skills in customer service, teamwork, and time management that are transferable to any business setting.

title: Genetic Research at CU Anschutz
subtitle: Laboratory research using advanced biotechnology
shortDescription: Performed genetic experiments using PCR and CRISPR technologies, maintained detailed data logs, and collaborated with research team under professional supervision.
longDescription: During my internship at CU Anschutz Medical Campus, I worked in Dr. Aaron Johnson's laboratory performing genetic experiments using cutting-edge biotechnology. This experience taught me scientific rigor, attention to detail, and the importance of precise documentation in research settings.
highlights: Performed PCR and CRISPR genetic experiments with 95%+ accuracy
Maintained detailed daily data logs and experimental records
Ensured compliance with CU Anschutz laboratory standards and protocols
Collaborated with team of 5 researchers on multiple projects
Learned advanced laboratory techniques and equipment operation
challenges: Learning complex laboratory techniques and maintaining precision in a highly technical environment. Through mentorship and consistent practice, I developed strong attention to detail and scientific methodology skills.
outcome: Successfully completed summer internship with strong performance reviews. Gained valuable experience in research methodology, data management, and team collaboration that strengthened my analytical and problem-solving abilities.

subtitle: Competitive analysis in cannabis packaging industry
shortDescription: Conducted comprehensive competitive analysis for sustainable cannabis packaging company, researching market trends and competitor positioning to identify growth opportunities.
longDescription: During my internship at CRATIV Solutions, I led a competitive analysis project focused on the cannabis and sustainable packaging industry. This involved researching key competitors, analyzing their product offerings, pricing strategies, and brand positioning to help the company identify market opportunities and strategic advantages.
highlights: Researched and tracked 15+ key competitors in cannabis packaging space
Compiled detailed reports on product offerings, pricing, and market activity
Presented findings to leadership team with actionable recommendations
Identified 3 major market gaps for potential business expansion
Analyzed sustainability trends and eco-friendly packaging innovations
challenges: The main challenge was gathering accurate competitive intelligence in a rapidly evolving industry with limited public data. I overcame this by leveraging multiple research methods including industry reports, trade publications, and direct market observation.
outcome: Successfully delivered comprehensive competitive analysis that informed CRATIV's strategic planning for Q3 2025. Leadership team used insights to refine product positioning and identify new market segments.

technologies.title: Speech & Debate Team Leadership
technologies.subtitle: Leading competitive team to regional success
technologies.shortDescription: Served as Speech & Debate Captain at Hinkley High School, leading team of 10 members in local and regional competitions while organizing practices and peer coaching.
technologies.longDescription: As captain of the Speech & Debate team during my senior year, I led a team of 10 members through local and regional competitions. I was responsible for organizing weekly practices, facilitating peer coaching sessions, and preparing the team for tournaments. This role developed my leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
highlights: Led team of 10 members to multiple regional competition placements
Organized and facilitated weekly practice sessions and strategy meetings
Mentored newer team members through peer coaching programs
Coordinated tournament logistics including travel and registration
Developed public speaking skills through competitive debate formats
technologies.challenges: Balancing leadership responsibilities with my own competition preparation while keeping team members motivated and engaged. Learned to delegate effectively and create inclusive team culture.
technologies.outcome: Team achieved best regional performance in school's history. Developed strong leadership and communication skills that I now apply in professional settings. Several team members continued to compete at collegiate level.

technologies.title: Cannabis Business Studies
technologies.subtitle: Academic foundation in emerging industry
technologies.shortDescription: Pursuing A.A.S. in Cannabis Business at Community College of Denver with focus on business fundamentals, accounting, and customer service in regulated industry.
technologies.longDescription: Currently pursuing an Associate of Applied Science degree in Cannabis Business, gaining comprehensive knowledge of business operations within the regulated cannabis industry. Coursework includes business fundamentals, accounting principles, and customer service excellence, all applied to the unique challenges of the cannabis sector.
highlights: Achieved Dean's List (2023) and President's List (2024) academic honors
Completed coursework in business, accounting, and customer service
Served as Vice President of student-run organization on campus
Received Outstanding Student Organization Award (2025)
Gained understanding of cannabis industry regulations and compliance
technologies.challenges: Balancing academic coursework with multiple internships and work commitments. Developed strong time management and prioritization skills to excel in both academic and professional settings.
technologies.outcome: Maintained high academic standing while gaining practical experience through internships. Built strong foundation for career in cannabis business management and operations.

subtitle: Full-stack online marketplace with payment integration
shortDescription: Built a scalable e-commerce platform with shopping cart, payment processing, and order management. Features real-time inventory tracking and responsive design.
longDescription: Developed a comprehensive e-commerce solution that handles thousands of products and concurrent users. The platform includes a robust admin panel for inventory management, dynamic pricing, and customer analytics. Integrated with Stripe for secure payment processing and implemented automated email notifications for order updates.
highlights: Microservices architecture with separate services for catalog, cart, and payments
Real-time inventory synchronization across multiple warehouses
Advanced search and filtering with Elasticsearch
Mobile-first responsive design achieving 95+ Lighthouse score
Automated testing with 85% code coverage
challenges: The main challenge was handling high traffic during flash sales while maintaining data consistency. Implemented Redis caching and database read replicas to handle 10,000+ concurrent users without performance degradation.
outcome: Successfully launched to production serving 50,000+ monthly active users with 99.9% uptime. Reduced page load times by 60% and increased conversion rate by 25%.

liveUrl.title: Task Management Application
liveUrl.subtitle: Collaborative project management tool for teams
liveUrl.shortDescription: A collaborative task management platform with real-time updates, kanban boards, and team collaboration features. Supports multiple projects and workflows.
liveUrl.longDescription: Created a modern project management solution that enables teams to organize work efficiently. Features include drag-and-drop kanban boards, Gantt charts, time tracking, and comprehensive reporting. Built with real-time collaboration using WebSockets for instant updates across all team members.
highlights: Real-time collaboration with WebSocket integration
Customizable workflows and project templates
Advanced filtering and search capabilities
Time tracking and productivity analytics
Integration with Slack and email notifications
liveUrl.challenges: Ensuring real-time synchronization across multiple users while handling offline scenarios and conflict resolution. Implemented operational transformation algorithms and optimistic UI updates for seamless user experience.
liveUrl.outcome: Adopted by 15+ companies with teams ranging from 5-50 members. Average user session time of 45 minutes indicates high engagement. Received 4.8/5 rating from early adopters.

liveUrl.title: Headless CMS for Portfolios
liveUrl.subtitle: Content management system for creative professionals
liveUrl.shortDescription: An open-source headless CMS tailored for portfolio websites. Features API-first architecture, markdown support, and media management.
liveUrl.longDescription: Developed a lightweight, API-first content management system specifically designed for portfolio websites and blogs. Provides a clean admin interface for managing projects, blog posts, and media assets. Supports multiple content types, custom fields, and RESTful API for integration with any frontend framework.
highlights: RESTful and GraphQL API support
Rich markdown editor with live preview
Media library with automatic image optimization
Role-based access control
Docker-based deployment for easy setup
Comprehensive API documentation
liveUrl.challenges: Balancing simplicity for end-users while providing flexibility for developers. Implemented a plugin system allowing custom field types and hooks without compromising core stability.
liveUrl.outcome: Released as open-source project with 500+ GitHub stars. Adopted by 100+ developers for their portfolio sites. Active community contributing plugins and translations.

liveUrl.title: Real-Time Analytics Dashboard
liveUrl.subtitle: Business intelligence platform with interactive visualizations
liveUrl.shortDescription: Interactive analytics dashboard providing real-time insights into business metrics. Features customizable widgets, data export, and scheduled reports.
liveUrl.longDescription: Built a comprehensive analytics platform that aggregates data from multiple sources and presents actionable insights through interactive visualizations. Includes support for custom dashboards, KPI tracking, and automated reporting. Handles millions of data points with sub-second query performance.
highlights: Real-time data streaming and visualization
Customizable dashboard with drag-and-drop widgets
Support for multiple data sources (SQL, APIs, CSV)
Advanced filtering and drill-down capabilities
Scheduled reports via email and Slack
Export to PDF, Excel, and CSV formats
liveUrl.challenges: Optimizing query performance for large datasets while maintaining real-time updates. Implemented data aggregation pipelines, materialized views, and smart caching strategies to achieve sub-second response times.
liveUrl.outcome: Deployed for enterprise client processing 10M+ events daily. Reduced manual reporting time by 80% and improved decision-making speed with real-time insights. Won internal innovation award.

liveUrl.title: Mobile Fitness Tracking App
liveUrl.subtitle: Cross-platform fitness and wellness application
liveUrl.shortDescription: Cross-platform mobile app for tracking workouts, nutrition, and wellness goals. Includes social features and progress visualization.
liveUrl.longDescription: Developed a comprehensive fitness tracking application that helps users monitor their health and fitness journey. Features include workout logging, meal tracking with nutrition database, progress photos, and achievement system. Integrated with wearable devices for automatic activity tracking.
highlights: Integration with Apple Health and Google Fit
Offline-first architecture with local storage
Social features for sharing progress and challenges
Custom workout builder with exercise library
Progress tracking with charts and statistics
Push notifications for workout reminders
liveUrl.challenges: Managing offline functionality and data synchronization across devices. Implemented robust conflict resolution and background sync to ensure data integrity even with intermittent connectivity.
liveUrl.outcome: Launched on iOS and Android with 10,000+ downloads in first month. Achieved 4.6/5 star rating. Daily active user rate of 45% indicating strong engagement.
